Hi Vladimir!

> Or course your program should handle this gracefully but with 
> a user freely
> entering information, you'll have surprises. 

One possible way to handle this is separating model and view. User Input
into the view updates the model, the model then updates the View and
displays an unambiguous version of the input.

I.e.: You enter '5/11/01', and the UI will in turn display 'May 11, 2001' as
a feedback to you. Sure - there still might be locale issues you weren't
aware of, but by giving feedback the user notices that the program's
internal representation does not agree with his idea what it should be.

- Robert
